Package core

Class Engine

java.lang.Object
core.Engine
public class Engine
extends java.lang.Object
This class is the main Engine class and handles all aspects of the EosGameEngine.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.util.List<Entity> getEntities()
    getter, returns the list of entities that exist in the game engine
    static Engine getInstance​(Window window)
    Getter, returns the instance of the game engine, if one does not exist, creates a new instance using the specified window and returns it
    Window getWindow()
    getter, returns the window which the engine instance is in
    void init()
    this function initializes the game engine it sets the game engine to 60 frames per second, initializes: -the Input class -the window object of the engine instance -every entity to be handled by the engine -the rendered class
    void loop()
    this function is the main loop of the game engine and implements the runtime operations of the engine.
    void setEntities​(java.util.List<Entity> entities)
    setter, sets the list of entities that are to be handled by the game engine
    void setWindow​(Window window)
    setter, sets the window in which the engine instance will be
    void start()
    this function handles the start, main loop and end of the game engine by calling the appropriate methods
    void stop()
    this function destroies every entity being handled by the game engine, the window of the engine instance and clears the Renderer class

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Engine getInstance​(Window window)
      Getter, returns the instance of the game engine, if one does not exist, creates a new instance using the specified window and returns it
      Parameters:
      window - window in which the game engine instance should be created, if one does not exist
      Returns:
      the instance of the game engine

    • getWindow

      public Window getWindow()
      getter, returns the window which the engine instance is in
      Returns:
      the window which the engine instance is in

    • setWindow

      public void setWindow​(Window window)
      setter, sets the window in which the engine instance will be
      Parameters:
      window - the window in which the engine instance will be

    • getEntities

      public java.util.List<Entity> getEntities()
      getter, returns the list of entities that exist in the game engine
      Returns:
      the list of entities that exist in the game engine

    • setEntities

      public void setEntities​(java.util.List<Entity> entities)
      setter, sets the list of entities that are to be handled by the game engine
      Parameters:
      entities - the list of entities that are to be handled by the game engine

    • start

      public void start()
      this function handles the start, main loop and end of the game engine by calling the appropriate methods

    • init

      public void init()
      this function initializes the game engine it sets the game engine to 60 frames per second, initializes: -the Input class -the window object of the engine instance -every entity to be handled by the engine -the rendered class

    • loop

      public void loop()
      this function is the main loop of the game engine and implements the runtime operations of the engine. the function prints the fps to console every second

    • stop

      public void stop()
      this function destroies every entity being handled by the game engine, the window of the engine instance and clears the Renderer class
